meanings.sent1: She would often misseat herself at the wrong table during lunch.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misseat the guests at the event; follow the seating plan.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to misseat itself on top of the fragile vase, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety misseated his thoughts, making it hard to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The misseated puzzle pieces did not fit together, creating a frustrating situation.

meanings.definition: To be seated in the wrong place or position.
meanings.sent1: The students tend to misseat themselves at the back of the classroom during exams.
meanings.sent2: If you misseat yourself on the bus, you may miss your stop.
meanings.sent3: The misseated doll looked quite funny sitting on top of the toy car.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt misseated in her chest as she nervously waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The misseated tree branch hung precariously over the roof, posing a danger.
